compilations.name: Protein-Packed Snacks
compilations.description: Whether you’re trying to be healthy, pulling an all-nighter, or just trying to get through the day, protein-packed snacks are your best friends. That’s because protein can give you an energy boost and help you stay fuller longer. From avocado deviled eggs to cacao chia pudding, these snacks are full of protein-packed ingredients like Greek yogurt and almond butter, which will ensure you don’t get hangry anytime soon.

compilations.name: Healthy Snacks For Late-night Cravings
compilations.description: Can't sleep? Want to snack? These delicious snacks are a quick and easy fix to all your after-midnight hunger pangs. Chomp down on some hummus and carrot sticks or devour a couple handfuls of delicious oven-roasted chickpeas. And once you're full and satisfied, sail softly back into dreamland!

Planning a trip to the beach to celebrate the coming of summer? These easy snacks will make sure you're fueled and ready for the next game of water polo. From parmesan garlic & herb pita chips to super easy to make banana roll-ups, these treats are beach-friendly and hassle free. So what are you waiting for? Pack up your picnic basket with these goodies: summer's here!
compilations.name: Easy Snacks To Pack For Your Next Beach Trip
Low Carb Meals For A Healthy You
compilations.description: Looking for low-carb options? We've got plenty for you! The crispy Chicken Piccata and the saucy Ratatouille Lasagna each pack tons of flavor without going overboard on carbs — and they pair well with just about anything. The hardest part? Choosing which dish to make first!

compilations.name: 31 Days 31 Avocado Recipes
compilations.description: You can never go wrong with avocado, and these easy mouthwatering recipes can enjoyed at any time of the day. Start your day with a wholesome Raddish Avocado Toast or enjoy a Salmon Crab Seafood Stack on a lunch date with your special someone. But why settle for one when you have 31 options to try from? Avo-fun for the whole month!

compilations.name: Make Healthy Snacks Tasty With These Recipes
Recipes For When You Don't Feel Like Working Out
compilations.description: We've all had those days when you just don't feel like working out. Regardless of whether or not you make it to the gym, these recipes will keep you feeling engaged, alert, and fueled up for whatever comes your way. From caprese avocado bowls to spinach pasta, these meals are nutritious, delicious, and nourishing.

With so many health benefits, you ought to use yogurt wisely and creatively! It is easy to digest, packed with vitamins, and a rich source of protein as well. Make the Honey Granola Yogurt Bark for your on-the-go meals. Paprika-Spiced Chicken With Lemon Yogurt And Crispy Potatoes is the perfect dinner recipe as it is delicious, easy and healthy, all at the same time!
compilations.name: Use Your Yogurt Wisely!

results.name: Low-Carb Avocado Chicken Salad

instructions.display_text: In a blender or food processor, combine the yogurt, lime juice, pepper, and chili powder and pulse to combine. Add ½ of the avocado and blend until creamy.
In a medium bowl, combine the chicken, yogurt sauce, celery, the remaining ½ avocado, onion, and salt. Mix until well combined.
Serve on low-carb bread and garnish with cilantro, or as desired.
Enjoy!

results.description: This chicken salad is a lunchtime delight! Packed with creamy avocado, tender chicken, and crunchy veggies, it's a healthy and satisfying meal that won't weigh you down. Tossed in a tangy yogurt dressing with a hint of spice, it's a flavor explosion that's perfect for a light meal.
results.keywords: avocado, chia pudding, chicken salad, chickpea chips, deviled eggs, easy, healthy, keto, protein, snacks, vegan, vegetarian
family dinner, jonah peretti, secret ingredient pasta, tasty, tasty_contains_alcohol, tomato and anchovy pasta recipe, umami pasta

components.raw_text: ¼ cup plus 1 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil, divided
1 teaspoon kosher salt, plus more to taste
1 pound spaghetti, cooked al dente, ¼ cup cooking water reserved
components.extra_comment: cooked al dente, 1/4 cup (60 ml) cooking water reserved

results.description: Savor the bold flavors of this Tomato and Anchovy Pasta, a perfect weeknight meal that's both simple and satisfying. With a zesty tomato sauce and umami-packed anchovies, this dish will have your taste buds dancing in no time!

instructions.display_text: Melt the butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add 4 of the chopped anchovy filets and cook for 1 minute, until they begin to melt.

Add the panko bread crumbs and cook for 3 minutes, stirring frequently, until golden brown. Transfer the bread crumbs to a medium bowl and let cool to room temperature. Once cooled, toss with the Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese.

Heat ¼ cup (60 ml) of olive oil in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat. Once the oil begins to shimmer, add the remaining 6 anchovies and cook for 2 minutes, stirring frequently, until the anchovies begin to melt into the oil.
Add the garlic and red pepper flakes and cook for 30 seconds, until fragrant.
Add the tomatoes and stir to coat in the oil. Season with 1 teaspoon of salt and cook for 5 minutes, or until the tomatoes just begin to soften.
Add the white wine and reduce the heat to low. Cook for 5 minutes, or until the sauce is reduced by half.

Add cooked pasta and reserved cooking water to the pot with the tomatoes and stir to combine. Cook for 1 minute, until the pasta is well coated and saucy. Drizzle with the remaining tablespoon of olive oil and season with salt. Toss to coat.
Serve the pasta topped with the anchovy bread crumbs and lemon zest
Enjoy!

results.name: Tomato And Anchovy Pasta

compilations.name: Tasty's Best Pasta Recipes
compilations.description: Having trouble deciding what you should make next? Take a look at a few of the best pasta recipes we have to offer! From a vegan version of mac 'n' cheese to delicious baked meatballs and spaghetti, these ideas will satisfy every craving. Pair your pasta with a salad, dessert, and glass of wine — and you've got a restaurant-quality menu right at home!

compilations.name: Make The Perfect Bowl Of Pasta With These Recipes
compilations.description: We've curated a special assortment of pasta recipes just for you. From our unique tomato anchovy pasta to mouth-watering chicken, bacon and goat cheese pasta, these recipes are made to impress! We're going to go eat our hearts out now: time to get cooking!

instructions.display_text: In a mixing bowl, beat eggs. Gradually add sugar. While beating slowly pour in oil. Add vanilla.
Combine the dry ingredients.
Add dry ingredients alternately with sour cream to the egg mixture.
Gently add blueberries.
Spoon into the greased muffin tin or paper liners
Bake at 400°F (200°C) for 20 minutes.
Enjoy!

results.description: This easy 30-minute pasta recipe transforms ingredients that you already have in your kitchen into a posh, seafood dish you’ll want to serve at your next dinner party. And since the whole dish is made in a single pot, clean-up is easy. Don’t be surprised if this becomes your favorite quick go-to.

instructions.display_text: In a large pot, boil water and add pasta. Cook (stirring frequently) until al dente.
Drain and set pasta aside.
In the same pan, heat olive oil and 2 tablespoons of butter. Add garlic and crushed red pepper, cook until fragrant.
Toss in shrimp, salt and pepper to taste, and stir until shrimp start to turn pink, but are not fully cooked.
Add oregano and spinach, cook until wilted.
Return cooked pasta to the pot, add remaining butter, parmesan, and parsley. Stir until well mixed and the butter is melted.
When the shrimp are cooked, add lemon juice, mix once more, then serve while hot.
Enjoy!

compilations.name: 7 Pasta Recipes For All Pasta Lovers
7 Pasta Recipes You'll Want To Bookmark ASAP

compilations.description: When life gives you lemons, make one of these recipes! These versatile lemon-forward dishes are easy to make and taste impressive. Not sure where to start? The creamy lemon chicken pairs well with just about anything, and the French-style lemon tart will definitely have people coming back for another slice.
compilations.name: Lemony and Tangy Recipes

compilations.description: You can never go wrong with shrimp, and these easy and delicious recipes will make sure everyone keeps coming back for seconds. Call your family and friends over for some fried shrimp mango salsa hand roll-up and whip up a couple of dozen honey Hawaiian garlic shrimp and watch everyone go ham on the shrimp!
compilations.name: Shrimp Lovers Only

compilations.description: Craving shrimp recipes? We’ve got you covered. But why settle for just one when we’ve curated 30 mouthwatering shrimp recipes to excite your tastebuds? Start with our crowd-pleasing Vegetable and Shrimp Lumpia or try a fancy Hawaiian Garlic Shrimp and Mac Salad. These impressive recipes won't let you down.

Make The Perfect Bowl Of Pasta With These Recipes

compilations.name: Dinner Recipes For Every Night In June
Recipes Leos Will Love

Our cheese-stuffed mashed potato balls are a hit at any party, just like your dazzliing personality. And the lemon garlic sshrimp pasta is the perfect match for your luxurious vibe. We also recommend you celebrate your life with the mango lime cheesecake/a>.

compilations.name: Make Healthy Snacks Tasty With These Recipes
Recipes To Celebrate Moving Out Of Your Parents House
compilations.description: Living on your own can get overwhelming having to keep up with grocery lists and meal prepping all by yourself. And that's why we've found just the right recipes that allow you to take it easy but also feel proud about taking care of yourself! The instant noodle lasagna is a twist on a lazy staple. And of course brownies are a must for your midnight munchy routine. This one just needsONE bowl! Bookmark this balsamic chicken and veggies meal prep recipe to meet your daily veggies and protein intake for busy weeks. Time for some adultin'!

compilations.name: A Healthy Start To Your Day!
compilations.description: Wake up in the morning and heat up last nights pizza? Is that you? Dont worry we have you covered! Start your day the healthy way by eating right! Your new day deserves and fresh and healthy start and with peanut-butter-energy-bites or why not try our healthier-fried-rice the options are endless!

You should be taking advantage of these recipes especially when you're pressed for time in the kitchen! With these, you can whip up a divine garlic shrimp scampi within 30 minutes. Want to make a quick lunch for office? Make a healthy thai tofu collard wraps for lunch. Cooking has never been quicker!
compilations.name: Meals In Under 30 Minutes

compilations.description: Who doesn't love pasta? Look forward to every single day of the week with these 7 amazing pasta dishes! You'll keep coming back for more, from creamy Chicken Alfredo to delectable Lemon and Garlic Spaghetti! Satisfy your mid-week cravings with Creamy One-Pot Spinach Shrimp Pasta. Serve up some al dente goodness all week long!
compilations.name: 7 Days, 7 Pasta Dishes

compilations.description: Looking for a way to brighten up your meals? Look no further! Start your day off right with some fluffy Lemon Ricotta Pancakes. Then, cool off in the afternoon with a refreshing Watermelon-Lime Slushie. Whether you're looking for something sweet or tangy, this collection of recipes featuring lemon, lime, and other citrus fruits has you covered. Get ready to add some zest to your meals!

compilations.description: Too lazy to cook? These super-quick and easy recipes are perfect for you! From our all time favorite cheesy garlic broccoli to juicy teriyaki chicken, these ideas will delight everyone's taste buds and keep you craving even more. Open up our treasure-trove of recipes and never go hungry ever again!
compilations.name: 3 Ingredient Recipes To Make Your Life Easy

compilations.description: Looking for a fancy meal to cook that doesn't require too much effort? These 3-ingredient, 3-course meal recipe sets are perfect for you. Whether it's a date night or a movie night with friends, cook up these meals in no time and serve to impress everyone. Start with mouth-watering jalapeno poppers and end your meal with a sweet chocolate strawberry braid. We've got something for every taste, no matter what.
compilations.name: 3-Ingredient 3 Course Meal

compilations.description: Having trouble meal-prepping? Not to fear, we've brought you a weekly meal plan for an entire week with just 3 ingredients for each dish. For instance, tuck into a hearty Tomato Avocado Egg Salad for a cozy Sunday at home. Take a glance and let us know which ones are your favorites!
compilations.name: 3 Ingredient Recipes For An Entire Week
No-Fuss Recipes For Those Lazy Days
compilations.description: Are you famished but too tired to cook? Well, look no further: these super easy recipes will keep all of your hunger pangs at bay. From a delicious two-ingredient chocolate cake to a three-ingredient teriyaki chicken you can whip up these mouthwatering (and fool-proof!) recipes in no time.

Chicken is always a crowd favorite, but we you gotta switch it up! Say goodbye to your plain Jane chicken recipes and taste test our carefully picked recipes. If you are a guac fiend like we are, you will absolutely devour the Bacon Guacamole Chicken Bombs and if you're going the fancy route, the Buffalo Chicken Dip is a must-have! Don't forget to pick your favorites!

Aprons at the ready – it's cooking time!

3-Ingredient Recipes That Will Change Your Life

Our baked halibut, Cajun BBQ ribs, and teriyaki chicken are absolutely delicious dinners, and best of all, they each require only three ingredients. Oh, how could we forget about dessert? Our hazelnut brownies and creme brulee are just as simple. From our kitchen to yours, you’re welcome.

Everyone can use a handful of quick, easy meals that fill you right up. From our versatile teriyaki chicken to our easy finger sandwiches, these recipes will keep you satisfied. Open up this treasure trove of recipes and bookmark them for lazy nights.

From a never-ending 100-Layer Lasagna to a filling Chili Cheese Casserole , these dishes will have everyone coming back for more!

instructions.display_text: Heat unsalted butter in a large skillet over medium high heat. Add garlic and cook, stirring frequently, until fragrant, about 1-2 minutes.
Add in the chicken broth, milk, and fettuccine. Season with salt and pepper.
Bring the pot to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer, stirring occasionally, until pasta is cooked through, about 18-20 minutes.
Stir in Parmesan. If the mixture is too thick, add more milk as needed until desired consistency is reached.
Serve immediately, and top with parsley.
Enjoy!

results.description: One pot. Garlic. Parmesan. Pasta. Need we say more? This dish is the ultimate in easy weeknight meals, with all the flavor and none of the fuss.

instructions.display_text: In a large, heavy-bottomed pot, melt the butter over medium heat until just bubbling. Add the sausage, then season with salt. Brown for 2 minutes on one side, then stir and brown on the other side for 2 minutes more.

Add the onion, season with salt, and cook for 2 minutes, until starting to soften. Add the jalapeño, garlic, and tomato paste. Stir to distribute the tomato paste. Add the Jazzy spice blend and stir to combine.

Add the pasta, red and green peppers, mushrooms, and salt and stir to combine. Pour in the tomatoes and stock. Bring to a gentle boil, then reduce the heat to low, cover, and simmer for 10-12 minutes, until the pasta is cooked through and the peppers are tender but not mushy.
Mix in the cream cheese to create a thick, creamy sauce.
Serve garnished with scallions, if desired.
Enjoy!

components.raw_text: 1 pound spicy Italian sausage links, cut into rounds
1 red bell pepper, seeded and thinly sliced
1 green bell pepper, seeded and thinly sliced

You’ll find easy after-school snacks like pizza chips, healthy but delicious breakfasts like these PB&J overnight oats, along with plenty of fun recipes to make with your kids for brunch or as a weekend activity. And fair warning: lots of these will be a big hit with the grownups, too!

compilations.description: How much chocolate is too much chocolate? These easy and tasty chocolatey treats cover all the bases for the chocolate season. Kick it off with crowd-pleasing classics like a Stuffed Chocolate Chip Cookie, or try a modern and Instagram-ready treat like Cookies 'n Cream Cheesecake Bundt Cake. Whatever you choose, just know that you can never go wrong with chocolate!
compilations.name: Is This Too Much Chocolate For Your Eyes?

compilations.description: Mug cooking is one of the greatest boons of our existence. You can snap up a quick, yet delicious, meal all in one dish. This rigatoni looks fancy AF, but comes out of a mug. Have frequent midnight cravings? Bookmark this pizza in a mug or check out these different flavored mug cakes. For busy mornings, we recommend this blueberry french toast in a mug. Get your mugs ready already!
compilations.name: Everything You Can Cook In A Mug

results.description: Indulge in a rich and decadent chocolate hazelnut dessert that's ready in minutes with this mug cake recipe. Made with simple pantry staples and a generous dollop of chocolate hazelnut spread, this cake is moist, fudgy, and oozing with luscious chocolate flavor.

instructions.display_text: In a 12-ounce (375 ml) mug or larger, mix all ingredients (except the chocolate hazelnut spread) until just combined.
Once combined, spoon the chocolate hazelnut spread on top of the batter.
Microwave on high for 90 seconds to 2 minutes, watching to make sure it doesn’t spill over (depending on the size of the mug).
Let cool one minute before eating. Top with additional chocolate hazelnut spread and powdered sugar (optional).
Enjoy!

components.raw_text: 1 tablespoon oil, such as vegetable or canola

instructions.display_text: In a large pot, cook the bacon over medium heat until crispy.
Add the shrimp, salt, and pepper and cook until the shrimp is pink and opaque. Remove the shrimp and bacon from the pot, leaving any fat from cooking the bacon behind.
Add the onions, tomatoes, and garlic to the pot and cook until the garlic is starting to brown.
Add the cream and bring to a boil.

Once the cream is boiling, add the fettuccine. Return the shrimp and bacon to the pan, along with the Parmesan cheese and parsley. Stir until the cheese melts and the sauce coats the shrimp and pasta nicely.

For a more decadent option, dig into the honey garlic slow cooker ribs. The 40-clove garlic chicken is also a must try. After all, we all know that there is no such thing as too much garlic!

The smoky flavor of the sliced meat along with its melting layers is a treat to dig into! Here's a guide to how you can create some amazing dishes using bacon. From cheesy-bacon-twists to href="https://tasty.co/recipe/bacon-wrapped-parmesan-garlic-knots"> bacon-wrapped-parmesan-garlic-knots , we can safely say, "Bacon makes everything better!"

And it's so versatile, you just can't go wrong! Indulge in some cheesy goodness with our 3-Ingredient Mac & Cheese, Garlic Shrimp Bacon Alfredo Pasta (now that's a mouthful, pun intended), or our favorite Classic Lasagna! Now let's cut to the cheese and make some amazing cheese dishes!

instructions.display_text: In a deep skillet, fry the bacon until crispy. Remove to a paper towel to drain, then chop.
In the same skillet, add the chicken and season with salt, pepper, Italian seasoning, and paprika. Cook until no longer pink inside.
Add the garlic and cook until softened.
Add spinach and tomatoes and cook until the spinach is wilted.
Add the cream, Parmesan, an red pepper flakes and bring to a boil.
Add the penne and bacon, and stir until fully coated in sauce.

results.description: Whip up these scrumptious 3-Ingredient Peanut Butter Cookies in a snap! With just peanut butter, sugar, and an egg, you'll have a delightful treat that's perfect for satisfying your sweet tooth.
results.name: 3 Ingredient Peanut Butter Cookies

instructions.display_text: Preheat oven to 350ºF (180ºC).
In a large bowl, mix together the peanut butter, sugar, and egg.
Scoop out a spoonful of dough and roll it into a ball. Place the cookie balls onto a nonstick baking sheet.
For extra decoration and to make them cook more evenly, flatten the cookie balls by pressing a fork down on top of them, then press it down again at a 90º angle to make a criss-cross pattern.
Bake for 8-10 minutes or until the bottom of the cookies are golden brown.
Remove from baking sheet and cool.
Enjoy!

compilations.description: Sometimes you need a snack and you need it now! These easy snack recipes will satisfy all your cravings. If you're in the mood for something savory, you only need three ingredients and 20 minutes to make pigs in a blanket. On the sweet side, you can whip up a super easy chocolate-hazelnut mug cake in even less time, and right in the microwave.
compilations.name: 7 Easy Snack Recipes For Every Mood
Three One-Pot Thanksgiving Sides That'll Save You Time
Cheat Meals To Have Before Your New Years Resolution Begins
A Beginner's Guide To Cooking At Home
If Famous Five Characters were a Recipe
compilations.description: Time for an adventure! Let's turn back in time to our childhood nostalgia. It's time to revisit the pages of your favorite Famous Five adventures, accompanied by these tasty recipes.  No matter who your favorite character is, we have a recipe for everyone, even for the fans of our favorite dog, Timmy!

results.description: This easy mac and cheese is a quick and delicious dinner option for busy weeknights! Elbow macaroni is cooked right in the same pot with milk, butter, and Cheddar cheese, resulting in a creamy and comforting dish that's sure to please everyone. Add in some chopped bacon or cooked veggies for a twist on the classic recipe, or enjoy it as-is for a simple and satisfying meal.

compilations.name: Tasty's Best Dinners Of 2020
compilations.description: 2020 has cooked up a storm in our lives and in our kitchens! We've hand-picked the best of the best trends of the year and are serving you some hot delicious dinners. From the insta-worthy Rainbow Grilled Chicken Salad to the Za'atar Chicken and Rice Pilaf, this year has been great for all you foodies! Remember, let's leave the year behind but not the recipes.

Tired of washing all the dishes after every meal? We know the feeling, and we've got your back. That's why we're bringing you the best of the kitchen sink, made magical by just a single pot! Test out our Turkey Chili with Cornbread Dumplings for a homely, comforting touch to your dish and pair it with our cozy Ham & Potato Soup. And don't worry, there's more where those came from. In fact, we bet you can't pick your favorites!
compilations.name: One Pot Meals You Must Try

compilations.description: It's Father's Day, and you know what that calls for? Dad-approved recipes and a whole bunch of Dad jokes! Make sure to test out the One Pot Cheeseburger Pasta with your Dad and then chase it down with his favorite Creamy Scalloped Potatoes! Paired with the perfect gifts and an afternoon BBQ, we're about to make this Father's Day the best one yet.
compilations.name: Dad Approved Recipes!

compilations.description: Cooking can be really therapeutic but what's not is, the heaps of dishes you have to wash right after. Let's tackle this, one pot at a time! Try the delicious One-pot Pad Thai or ultimate Creamy Tuscan Chicken where we compromise on the pot but not on the taste!
compilations.name: 7 One-Pot Recipes!

compilations.description: The best time of the year has arrived. The summer vacation is going to be a whole lot tastier. We have assembled a perfect culinary voyage for your kids. From the classic Mac & Cheese to the Softest Sugar Cookies ever, this summer season is gonna be one to remember!
compilations.thumbnail_alt_text: Summer Break Recipes For Your Kids
compilations.name: Summer Break Recipes For Your Kids

instructions.display_text: In a large pot over a medium-high heat, add ground beef, onions, garlic, salt, pepper, worcestershire sauce, and ketchup. Break up the beef to incorporate the seasonings and cook until browned, about 6-7 minutes.
Pour in the beef broth and one cup of water and bring to a simmer.
Add the pasta and simmer for 20 minutes or until the pasta is cooked throughout and the broth has cooked down, stirring occasionally.
Pour in the milk and cheese. Stir until the cheese has melted.
Serve garnished with some sliced green onions
Enjoy!

results.name: One-Pot Cheeseburger Pasta
results.description: This One-Pot Cheeseburger Pasta is a delightful twist on a classic favorite. With its savory flavors and easy clean-up, this dish is perfect for busy weeknights and satisfying comfort food cravings.

results.name: Creamy Lemon Chicken
results.keywords: buzzfeed, chicken, creamy, dinner, lemon, one-pan, quick and easy, tasty
results.description: Whip up this zesty Creamy Lemon Chicken for a dinner that's bursting with flavor! With tender chicken, a velvety sauce, and a hint of citrus, this dish is sure to become a weeknight favorite.

instructions.display_text: On a cutting board, cut the chicken breasts in half, widthwise.
Lay chicken flat and season both sides with salt and pepper.
Gently coat the chicken pieces in the flour, shaking off any excess.
Heat a skillet on medium-high heat and add the butter and oil, swirling together to coat the pan.
Place the chicken breasts into the pan and cook for 3-5 minutes or until golden brown.
Flip the chicken and cook the other side, another 3-5 minutes, or until chicken is cooked through.
Remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.
Pour ¼ cup (60 ml) of the chicken stock in the pan and scrape up any bits that may have stuck to the bottom of the pan.
Add the rest of the stock and the cream and stir.
Season with salt and pepper, and add the lemon juice.
Simmer for 5 minutes. Add the chicken back to the pan and top with sliced lemons.
Spoon the sauce over the chicken.
Remove from heat. Sauce will thicken as it cools.
Serve with parsley and extra sauce.
Enjoy!

compilations.description: When life gives you lemons, make one of these recipes! These versatile lemon-forward dishes are easy to make and taste impressive. Not sure where to start? The creamy lemon chicken pairs well with just about anything, and the French-style lemon tart will definitely have people coming back for another slice.
compilations.name: Lemony and Tangy Recipes

compilations.description: These citrus-y meals will help you get through the tough times with ease and a splash of brightness. Start your day with fancy breakfasts curated especially for your special someone. Take your pick from a Creamy Lemon Chicken or an easy, Lemon Ricotta Pancakes. But wait, just before you eat, make your sure to keep your phone handy for those beautiful Instagram shots!
compilations.name: When Life Gives You Lemons! Make These Amazing Recipes
Chicken Recipes For The Whole Month
compilations.description: No one can resist a good piece of finger-lickin' chicken. There are billions of ways to cook it, but if you've found yourself in a chicken rut lately, look no further than what we're about to offer you. Lighten it up with our Chicken and Veggie Stir Fry, or indulge in classic comfort with some Chicken & Dumplings. Want something fancy and indulgent? We've got a creamy and rich Chicken Cordon Bleu that'll make even Julia Child proud. It's chicken night at your house, and we're inviting ourselves over.

compilations.name: Tangy Recipes For When Life Gives You Lemons

results.name: How To Make The Fluffiest Pancakes

components.raw_text: 1 tablespoon unsalted butter, plus more for serving

instructions.display_text: In a large bowl, add the flour, sugar, salt, baking powder, and baking soda and whisk to combine.
In a medium bowl or liquid measuring cup, add the buttermilk, melted butter, and egg yolks and whisk to combine.
Add the buttermilk mixture to the dry ingredients and gently fold with a rubber spatula until just combined.
Add the egg whites and fold until just combined. Be sure not to overmix. Some lumps are okay.
Let the batter rest for 15-30 minutes at room temperature.
Add the butter to a cast iron skillet and heat over medium low heat. Once the butter has melted and is bubbling, reduce the heat to medium-low and add ⅓ cup (75 g) of batter to the pan.

Cook for 2-3 minutes, until bubbles start to appear on the surface. If adding any toppings like chocolate chips or blueberries, sprinkle over the pancake. Flip the pancake over and cook for another 1-2 minutes, until golden brown. Repeat with the remaining batter.
Serve the pancakes with butter and maple syrup.
Enjoy!

compilations.name: Tasty's Greatest Bites Of All Time

results.name: Easy Glazed Pork Chops

compilations.name: 10 Easy And Fancy Dinner Recipes
compilations.description: It’s alright to want to be fancy. After all, what’s better than a gourmet, home-cooked meal at the end of a long day? But if actually cooking it is where you get stuck, we’re here to help. Whether you’re craving a comforting chicken Parmesan or want to get fancy with a classy prime rib, these recipes will bring gourmet straight to your kitchen. So grab your apron, because gourmet is about to get fun, easy, and super delicious.

compilations.name: Steak Vs Pork
compilations.description: The two champions of meat, steak and pork, reign supreme in flavor and the possibilities with what you can do with them. Get inspired by Asia and experiment with Korean-style BBQ pork or even some succulent BBQ beef. Looking for something quick and easy? Our easy flap steak or some glazed pork chops should be you go-to recipes. So steak or pork, we won't judge - just take your pick, and get cookin'!

Looking for low-carb options? We've got plenty for you! The crispy Chicken Piccata and the saucy Ratatouille Lasagna each pack tons of flavor without going overboard on carbs — and they pair well with just about anything. The hardest part? Choosing which dish to make first!
compilations.name: Low Carb Meals For A Healthy You
30 Recipes To Learn Before You Turn 30
compilations.description: You're in your 20s and faced with the realities of life. One of those harsh ones? The need to feed. Luckily for you, we've got 30 recipes to master before you're 30: the perfect way to feed yourself. Learn how to make a great glaze for your Pork Chops, how you should cook a Steak In Garlic Butter just to your liking, or something even simpler: a perfect batch of Cookies. The ball's in your court, and so are the delicious eats.

If you're looking to eat low carb this week, you're in the right place. We've got recipes that cut the carbs without sacrificing flavor at all. On Mondays, when you just don't have the energy to do anything, test out our energy-boosting Low Carb Egg White Omelet. Feeling a little more indulgent? Give our Low Carb Eggplant Lasagna a shot! Whatever you pick, you can't go wrong.
compilations.name: Low Carb Meals For A Week

compilations.description: Can't decide what to cook for your family? We've got you covered! Here are 25 of the best dinners you can make. Low on time and want to keep it simple? Try our easy veggie curry. Or, if you're in the mood to treat everyone to something fancy, make our French pepper steak. It’s a guaranteed way to impress your dinner table.
compilations.name: 25 Amazing Dinners From Tasty

compilations.description: Are you ready for these pork-tastic presentations of our favorite recipes? Then gear up: Our glazed pork chops are child's play, but they're a good place to start. And a bowl of this braised pork adobo looks a lot more complex than it is. If you really want to impress, try out our Mexican pork tamales. For something truly exotic? Lechon: a pork delicacy. Let's pork it up!
compilations.name: Easy To Hard: Pork Recipes
7 New Year's Food For Good Luck!

compilations.description: What's a better way to spend time with family than at the dinner table! Check out these lip-smacking dinners to cook with your family. Start off with a whole one pan salmon and veggies on the side. And let's not forget the drool-worthy & exquisite 40 clove garlic chicken. These hearty meals are all worth it and just what a family needs!
compilations.name: Recipes To Cook At Family Dinner

compilations.description: End the year with a culinary big bang! 2022 is coming to an end, but your nights shouldn't without tasting these delicious recipes. We have got Baked Lobster Tails, Creamy Tuscan Chicken, Korean-Style BBQ Beef, or a 20-Minute One-Pan Pizza to cover all of your cravings. Are you convinced or should we go on?
compilations.name: Tasty Dinners for Every Night of December

results.description: Easy glazed pork chops are a quick and tasty dinner option that can be made in under 30 minutes. They are coated in a sweet and savory glaze that caramelizes on the outside of the pork chops when cooked.

instructions.display_text: In a bowl, combine your spices (paprika, cayenne pepper, garlic powder, black pepper, and salt).
Rub the pork chops in the spices generously.

Heat olive oil in an oven-safe skillet over medium/high heat. When the oil is hot, add the pork chops. Cook for about 3-5 minutes on each side or until they have a nice caramelized brownness to them. Once you feel that they are looking browned, add a Tablespoon of brown sugar to each pork chop. Turn each pork chop over, so both sides get some melted brown sugar. (Don’t add the brown sugar too early or else the sugar will burn and smoke up the room.)
Bake at 350˚F (175˚C) for 15 minutes, making sure the pork chops are cooked through.
Before serving, pour the glaze that’s formed in the pan over the chops. Serve with your vegetables of choice.
Enjoy!

results.description: This garlic shrimp scampi is a flavor explosion in your mouth! The succulent shrimp is cooked to perfection and coated in a heavenly garlic and butter sauce. Toss in some lemon juice and parsley, and you've got yourself a dish that'll transport you straight to the Italian coast.

compilations.name: Amazing Budget-Friendly Dinners
compilations.description: Adulting is hard, and so is budgeting. From garlic shrimp scampi to chili cheese dog boats, these budget-friendly meals will keep you fueled without emptying out your wallet. Indulgent, comforting, and easy to throw together, these recipes are perfect when you need to feed yourself without spending a fortune! So what are you waiting for? Tuck away your wallet and let’s get cooking.

compilations.name: 6 Delicious And Unique Spaghetti Recipes You Cannot Resist

compilations.description: Busy week? These dinner recipes are perfect after a long day of work, when you just don't feel like cooking something overly elaborate. From easy shrimp scampi toveggie curry with naan, all of these dishes are simple, tasty, and take less than 20 minutes to prepare.
compilations.name: 5 Simple and Scrumptious Weeknight Dinners
Foods That Will Transport You To Italy
compilations.description: It's been a long time since you've had a classic getaway that lets you escape the stresses of life. Well, don't worry, you don't need to splurge on a plane ticket just yet – we can bring your ideal Italian adventure to you! Yes, you heard right. Whether you whip up a cheesy, One Pan Pepperoni Pizza or our light and luxurious Zucchini Ravioli, we promise you'll love these Italian delights.

Planning a last-minute dinner can be stressful. How are you supposed to throw together an impressive feast with little notice? Before you panic, look no further. We've got an array of recipes that'll wow your dinner guests. Hey, you might even impress yourself.
compilations.name: Perfect Recipes For Last Minute Dinner Plans

results.name: Garlic Shrimp Scampi

instructions.display_text: Heat the pot over medium heat.
Melt the butter in the pot.
Cook the garlic until it starts to brown.
Add the shrimp, salt, and pepper, cooking until shrimp is pink all the way through.
Add the lemon juice, chili flakes, and parsley.
Add the spaghetti, and toss until evenly coated.
Enjoy!

compilations.name: 6 Healthy Versions Of Your Favorite Breakfast Recipes

compilations.description: Thinking you want to switch into super healthy mode for a few weeks? We have got you covered for an entire month! Start your February with a super delicious protein-packed Buddha bowl, then have banana pancakes on first Sunday of the week. Stop brainstorming about what to eat and dig in and fill your mouth with these healthy and amazing recipes.
compilations.name: 28 Healthy Recipes For February

compilations.description: Eating on a tight budget doesn't mean you need to sacrifice flavor or on quality ingredients. The chili cheese dog boats pack a punch and are easy on the wallet. Our freezer-prep bean burritos are under $10 and will fill you right up! Meanwhile, the spaghetti with garlic and oil is perfect for when you're running low on grocery goods. Eat well, live well, save well, spend well - but never say no to flavor.
compilations.name: Budget-Friendly Dinner Recipes You'll Want To Bookmark ASAP

compilations.description: Are you looking for a fun, innovative way to switch up your Saturday pancake routine? Look no further than some of our favorite pancakes at home! Start with these all-time favorite Chocolate Pancakes or enjoy some innovative Net Pancakes with your friends. After all, who doesn't love to start their day with some sweet treats?
compilations.name: Perfect Pancakes To Lift Your Mood
Recipes For When You Are Broke
compilations.description: Budgeting can be really hard, but you know what's easy? Making these supremely tasty, wallet-friendly meals! Test out the best-in-town Chili Cheese Dog Boats. Chase those right down with a soul-soothing Potato Leek Soup that'll warm you up from head to toe. Eating deliciously doesn't have to be expensive or time-consuming. So, ready to get cooking?

compilations.name: Simplify Your Week With These Tasty Recipes
compilations.description: Let's face it: we all love food. What we don't like, though? Tedious and over-complicated recipes that make you throw your hands up in frustration and pull up your UberEats app as quickly as possible. Well look no further and try out these recipes that are set to make your week easy, simple, and oh-so-delicious!

compilations.name: A Healthy Start To Your Day!
compilations.description: Wake up in the morning and heat up last nights pizza? Is that you? Dont worry we have you covered! Start your day the healthy way by eating right! Your new day deserves and fresh and healthy start and with peanut-butter-energy-bites or why not try our healthier-fried-rice the options are endless!

The new year is upon us and so is the time to make some choices in life. Let’s make a resolution to enter 2023 with healthier habits. From Weekday Meal-Prep Pesto Chicken & Veggies to a Berry Smoothie Bowl, we have got your culinary pact covered.
compilations.name: Healthy Recipes for Your New Year's Resolutions

compilations.description: Sometimes you just want to cook something easy and delicious that won’t leave a dent in your wallet. From a delicious and vegan-friendly Cauliflower Gnocchi to a classic Grilled Gheese, these budget-friendly recipes are our top picks for meals that don't cost a fortune. Come on, let’s get cooking!
compilations.name: Budget-Friendly Recipes 8 Ways!

results.description: These pancakes are fluffy, moist, and delicious, and best of all, they're healthy! Made with ripe bananas, whole wheat flour, and no added sugar, they're a guilt-free breakfast option.
results.name: Healthy Banana Pancakes

instructions.display_text: Mash bananas in a large bowl until smooth. Mix in eggs and vanilla until well combined, then mix in oats and cinnamon.

Heat a skillet to medium and add in a scoop* of the pancake batter. Smooth out to form an even layer. Cook for about 2-3 minutes until you start to see bubbles releasing from the top of the batter. Flip and cook until the other side is golden brown, about 1-2 minutes.
Garnish your pancakes with your favorite toppings! We used banana slices, chopped walnuts & maple syrup.
*Note: Use ½ cup (65) for scooping the batter to yield 4 thicker pancakes; Use ⅓ cup (40 g) to yield 6 smaller pancakes.
Enjoy!
In a bowl, add the flour, sugar, salt, baking powder, and baking soda, and whisk to combine.
In a bowl or measuring cup, whisk the buttermilk, eggs, and melted butter until smooth.
Add the buttermilk mixture to the dry ingredients, gently incorporating with a spatula. Make sure not to overmix, as that will result in dense pancakes.
Add the butter to a pan over medium low heat. Once the butter begins to bubble, add ⅓ cup (80 ml) of batter to the pan.
Cook until the top side begins to bubble and the bottom is golden brown. Flip the pancake and cook until the underside is golden brown. Repeat with the remaining batter.
Enjoy!

results.description: Is there any better way to start the day than with a stack of warm and fluffy pancakes? Buttermilk gives these cakes that signature tang, while a combination of baking powder and baking soda creates an unbeatable lift. This recipe yields perfect plain pancakes every time, but feel free to add your favorite mix-ins—like blueberries, chocolate chips, or bananas—to the batter before cooking. Bonus? Pancakes freeze well, so make a double batch and store in the freezer for easy breakfasts all week. No stovetop flipping required!
results.name: Buttermilk Pancakes

Have a extra carton of buttermilk in the fridge and not sure what to do with it? We've got you covered. Start with our crowd-pleasing Buttermilk Fried Chicken or a plate of goes-with-anything Fried Heirloom Tomatoes With Buttermilk. Take your pick and let’s get started!

Try out our homemade pop-tart recipe to feel closer to Rory and Lorelai's lifestyle. Our Chicken Teriyaki Chow Mein is just like takeout from Al's Pancake World (we presume). Start off with a simple but stunning Spaghetti with Garlic and Oil. Then, work your way up to a MasterChef-worthy Tomato Risotto with Shrimp, courtesy of the one and only Wolfgang Puck! We've got everything you need for a pasta party. Mangia!

Well then, we're here to save your day with these easy recipes that are anything but boring. Test out our scrumptious Sweet Potato Chips.Then, follow them up with a fun and flavorful plate of Spaghetti with Garlic & Oil. Try out these foolproof recipes and tell all your friends – get ready to impress them with your surprise cooking skills! Believe me, they're going to be floored.

It's been a long time since you've had a classic getaway that lets you escape the stresses of life. Well, don't worry, you don't need to splurge on a plane ticket just yet – we can bring your ideal Italian adventure to you! Yes, you heard right. Whether you whip up a cheesy, One Pan Pepperoni Pizza or our light and luxurious Zucchini Ravioli, we promise you'll love these Italian delights.

For a sweet start to your morning, try out our Blueberry Banana Pancakes, then whip up a batch of our super-filling Chicken & Veggie Stir Fry for a hearty weeknight meal. The best part? Your wallet's doing a happy dance.

Bring Italy To Your Kitchen

All hail the vegan variety hour! Here's a highlight reel of delicious recipes that happen to be vegan. From a quick Chickpea Salad Sandwich to a hearty Eggplant Potato Tomato Stew, Tasty is bringing deliciously amazing recipes to all our vegan fans.

instructions.display_text: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil.  Cook the pasta according to package instructions. Save ¼ cup (60 ml) of pasta water, then drain.
Add the olive oil and garlic to a large cold sauté pan. Turn the heat to medium-low and slowly heat up until the garlic is fragrant and lightly colored, about 3 minutes.
Add the chile flakes and cook for another minute.
Add the reserved pasta water and bring to a simmer. Add the cooked spaghetti and parsley, if using. Stir until the pasta is well-coated. Season with salt to taste.
Enjoy!

results.description: Spaghetti with garlic and oil is a classic Italian dish that's quick and easy to make, with just a few simple ingredients.
results.name: Spaghetti With Garlic And Oil
